c74object.name: fl.onepole~
c74object.digest: Applies a one-pole 6dB/octave filter to the input
c74object.description: Output is the same length as the input. The filter can output a single specifed mode at a time. Alternatively, in multi-output mode all modes are output simultaneously. Filter settings may be made either via parameters or per sample via inputs. The dynamic parameter is set to create the inputs for per sample values. Frames of per sample values are padded to length with their final value if required. Additional values are ignored. In this mode the parameter value is used if no corresponding input is provided. Thus, per sample values and parameters can be mixed. To process streams (not discrete frames) the reset parameter can be set off. This prevents the filter memories being cleared between frames.

entry.name: /mode [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the filter mode when multi-output mode is off:
[0] - lowpass - low pass.[1] - highpass - high pass.

entry.name: /multi_output [instantiation bool]
entry.description: Creates an output per filter mode with all modes output simultaneously.

entry.name: /dynamic [instantiation bool]
entry.description: Creates inputs for per sample values for each of the filter parameters. If an input is not provided the corresponding parameter value is used.

entry.name: /reset [bool]
entry.description: Determines whether filter memories are reset before processing a new frame.

objarg.name: freq
objarg.description:
This argument sets the freq parameter:
Sets the filter cutoff frequency.

objarg.name: mode
objarg.digest: Sets the filter mode when multi-output mode is off
objarg.description:
This argument sets the mode parameter:
Sets the filter mode when multi-output mode is off:
[0] - lowpass - low pass.[1] - highpass - high pass.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.onepole~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.onepole~. When set to 0 fl.onepole~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.onepole~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
